) Audience: IRS Tax Technicians and Account Management employees. (
) Policy Owner: Chief Information Officer. (
) Program Owner: Customer Service. (
) Primary Stakeholders: Wage & Investment(W&I) (
) Program Goals: This system manages data extracted from Corporate Data Stores (BMF, IMF, EPMF) allowing IRS employees to takespeciﬁc on taxpayer account issues and track status of an account . (

) This section provides instructions that will release undelivered refund checks from the Individual Master File (IMF) and Business Master File (BMF) an on-line process. Designated service centers and remote ﬁeld offices will CHK
enter the command code “CHK
R” which is used to invoke the format for command code “CHK
”. After the data for CC CHK
has been inputted on to the database, it will create the reissue entity update (TC
), close the control base, and generate Notice
(T/P notice of reissue action). (

) Only on-line actions are inputted onto the IMF and BMF database. All accounts must be processed using CC RFUND. The CC EOCHG is used for of any name line changes and the CC ENCHG is used for address changes. CHK
) In all cases, for input to be accepted, the speciﬁc tax module containing an (TC–
) freeze must be on the Taxpayers Information File (TIF). Dummy Memo modules are not accept. (
) CHK
R will determine from the TIN and File Source which IMF or BMF screen format will be displayed. (
) A complete address must be entered on all on-line inputs. When there is no street address, “LOCAL” must be input in the street address ﬁeld. (
) A sequence of two command codes is required to allow input to be
Enter CC TXMOD to verify tax module’s existence on the TIF.
Enter CC CHK
R to request the format for CHK
) When a CHK
display is requested through CC CHK

R, name and data will be displayed from the name and address section of the IDRS Taxpayer Information File if available. This data is overlaid if the name and address is not current because the taxpayer has a new name and/or change. All changes made will be subject to validation by the main CHK
cessing. This change will be posted with the release of the “S” freeze. (
) For tax accounts having more than one module that contains an “S” freeze, only one CHK
need be input. It may be desirable to research via ENMOD to determine if CHK
has already been input. You may wish to record history items using CC ACTON on the other modules involved. (

Codes CHK64 and CHK64R 2.4.21

This section provides instructions that will release undelivered refund checks from the Individual Master File (IMF) and Business Master File (BMF) through an on-line process. Designated service centers and remote ﬁeld offices will enter the command code “CHK
R” which is used to invoke the format for command code “CHK
”. After the data for CC CHK
has been inputted on to the database, it will create the reissue entity update (TC
), close the control base, and generate Notice
(T/P notice of reissue action).
control base, and generate Notice
(T/P notice of reissue action). (

) Only on-line actions are inputted onto the IMF and BMF database. All accounts must be processed using CC RFUND. The CC EOCHG is used for any name line changes and the CC ENCHG is used for address changes. (
) In all cases, for input to be accepted, the speciﬁc tax module containing an (TC–
) freeze must be on the Taxpayers Information File (TIF). Dummy Memo modules are not accept. (
) CHK
R will determine from the TIN and File Source which IMF or BMF screen format will be displayed. (
) A complete address must be entered on all on-line inputs. When there is no street address, “LOCAL” must be input in the street address ﬁeld. (
) A sequence of two command codes is required to allow input to be
Enter CC TXMOD to verify tax module’s existence on the TIF.
Enter CC CHK
R to request the format for CHK
) When a CHK
display is requested through CC CHK

R, name and data will be displayed from the name and address section of the IDRS Taxpayer Information File if available. This data is overlaid if the name and address is not current because the taxpayer has a new name and/or change. All changes made will be subject to validation by the main CHK
cessing. This change will be posted with the release of the “S” freeze. (
) For tax accounts having more than one module that contains an “S” freeze, only one CHK
need be input. It may be desirable to research via ENMOD to determine if CHK
has already been input. You may wish to record history items using CC ACTON on the other modules involved.
A complete address must be entered on all on-line inputs. When there is no street address, “LOCAL” must be input in the street address ﬁeld.
IDRS Terminal (
) Case Control a. No other employee can input CHK
data when the control base is S, A, or M. However, a case controlled to another employee but status B or C does not prohibit CHK

input. b. An additional control base is not established when the last control of that module has the terminal operator’s employee number as the assignee number and it was updated to status C today. CHK

input case control information would be ignored by the computer. c. A control base is generated automatically when the input terminal operator has no control base established for the module. The control base number may be entered via the screen. “C#” will be inserted if alternative is input. Category “

”, status “C”, and activity code SUECHK ” will always be inserted. d. If the input terminal operator has an open control base established the module, activity code “REISSUECHK” will be generated. e. If TXMOD displays an “E” in position
or SUMRY displays an “E” in position
; the entity module contains an open control base which be related to your case. Contact the controlling employee before action. (
) When all action is completed and CHK
is released, assemble work and mark with date, employee number, and sequence number, Forward for association with Form
(IDRS Transaction Record) and for ﬁling. “IDRS Transaction input” in the GENERAL IDRS TRANSACTION INPUT section of IRM

for INCHG and BNCHG are applicable. (

input case control information would be ignored by the computer. c. A control base is generated automatically when the input terminal operator has no control base established for the module. Codes CHK64 and CHK64R 2.4.21

1 = Program unable to ﬁnd tax module because of a FETCH fail. 2 = Program possibly unable to update control base because of a STORE fail 3 = Program unable to update control base because of an ADDCNTRL fail. 4 = Program unable to update control base because there is no room on the account. 5 = Program unable to update control base because there is no room in the control base section of the account. (4) Terminal Error Responses:
= Program unable to ﬁnd tax module because of a FETCH fail.
= Program possibly unable to update control base because of a STORE fail
= Program unable to update control base because of an ADDCNTRL fail.
= Program unable to update control base because there is no room on the account.
= Program unable to update control base because there is no room in the control base section of the account.

2.4 IDRS Terminal Input ERROR ERROR MESSAGE(S) MEANING/PROCEDURE (*) Asterisk following the data ﬁeld Error in the data entered or an inconsistency between two or more ﬁelds. Review ﬁelds followed by asterisks, correct data and re-enter. “TIF NOT UPDATED — An addition to the EP transaction OVERFLOW WOULD RESULT” would cause the TIF record to exceed maximum size. TIF has not been updated. Try again Monday. “BASE CLOSED, B STATUS, OR Wrong control base number was NOT PRESENT” used to overlay “C#”. Check TXMOD and your case. If data matches and the base is closed, no action is necessary unless there is some indication that previous action taken was incorrect, or if data matches and the case is assigned to another operator, check with the other operator before taking further action. “COMMAND CODE INITIALIZA- sequence was not followed. TION INVALID” Initiate TXMOD. “COMMAND CODE VALID ONLY TIN ﬁle source is R or N identify- FOR IMF OR BMF” ing an IMF or BMF module. If ﬁle source is correct, re- issuance of the check must be made under manual procedures. If ﬁle source is incorrect, re-enter correct TXMOD inquiry. “EMP. NO. INVALID — CASE A case on the same module is CONTROLLED” controlled in status S, A, or M to another employee. Associate cases to one employee and re- enter. “ID INFO CHANGED — Generated TIN, MFT, NAME RESTART” CONTROL or TAX PERIOD has been altered. Correct to original data or restart with TXMOD. MODULE DOES NOT CONTAIN The TIF module CHK64R is at- TC740/(S) FREEZE tempting to access does not contain TC740. Initiate TXMOD to determine the correct year.

An addition to the EP transaction would cause the TIF record to exceed maximum size. TIF has not been updated. Try again Monday. Wrong control base number was used to overlay “C#”. Check TXMOD and your case. If data matches and the base is closed, no action is necessary unless there is some indication that previous action taken was incorrect, or if data matches and the case is assigned to another operator, check with the other operator before taking further action. sequence was not followed. Initiate TXMOD.
Codes CHK64 and CHK64R

CHK64 and CHK64R 2.4.21 page 5 ERROR ERROR MESSAGE(S) MEANING/PROCEDURE “OPEN BASE (S) ASSIGNED TO You are attempting to establish a OPERATOR” control base on a module which already contains an open control base assigned to you. Check TXMOD for the correct control base number and use this number to overlay the “# 14”. If you really need both control bases you must change the case status of the ﬁrst control base to “B” (background) before estab- lishing a new control base. “PLEASE CORRECT INVALID Displays whenever a ﬁeld is as- DATA ON SCREEN” terisked. Correct and re-enter. “REMARKS FIELD IS INVALID Either of two error conditions OR INCOMPLETE” generate this error message: The ﬁeld includes one or more of the following characters: &lt., > ;, [, ], or =. Eliminate the illegal charac- ters and re-enter. The ﬁeld contains no remarks. Explain reason or source for Re-issuance of refund check and re-enter. “REQUEST DENIED/IMPROPER TIN, MFT, and TAX PERIOD not TAX PERIOD” on the TIF. Initiate TXMOD. “REQUEST DENIED/MEMO Module or account addressed is ACCT/MOD PRESENT” in a re-sequence condition. Input may not be made until the re- sequence action is completed. “TIF–04 NOT AVAILABLE — Name and Address Section for PLEASE INPUT” the module speciﬁed is not on the TIF. Input the data from the hard copy. “SYSTEM ERROR ON ACCESS/ I/O error, retry. If transmisson not UPDATE” successful on the retry, contact the RPA. “OVERLAID LITERAL/ENTER The literal: “ADD, CY/ST/ZP, N1 ENTRY-CD& XMIT AGAIN” or N2”, one or more of the literals was overlaid or moved out of position. Retry.
This Page Intentionally Left Blank
CC CHK64R — use this command code to request the format for CHK64. TXMOD must precede this request and the module must be present on the TIF and contain an “S” freeze.
Record Element Description
Item Line Position Description 1 1 1–6 CHK64R — Enter
Terminal Responses

Valid response is a display of the format for CHK64. The TIN, ﬁle source, and name control taken from TXMOD are generated on line 1 in positions 7–18 and 20–23. The MFT, PLAN-RPT-NUM, and TAX period from TXMOD are generated on line 1 in positions 25–26 , 28–30, and 32–37.

Codes CHK64 and CHK64R 2.4.21
Exhibit 2.4.21-2 (Cont. 1) (01-01-2006) CHK64R Output Display
Element Description — BMF/IMF Elements in line 1 position 39 and line 2 through 9 are to be the correct information.
Exhibit 2.4.21-2 (Cont. 2) (01-01-2006) CHK64R Output Display

2.4.21-2 (Cont. 2) (01-01-2006) Output Display Element Line Position Description & Validity IMF/BMF 1 1 1–5 CHK64 — Generated 2 1 7–18 TIN (Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number) and File Source — Generated 3 1 20–23 NAME CONTROL — Generated 4 1 25–26 MFT CODE — Generated. This will be the MFT of the module accessed by TXMOD. 4 1 28–30 PLAN-RPT-NUM — Generated. This will be the PLAN- RPT-NUM of the module accessed by TXMOD. 5 1 32–37 MODULE PERIOD — Generated. This will be the tax period for the module accessed by TXMOD. 6 1 39 NOTICE INDICATOR – “Y” is generated and will issue notice of re-mail activity unless overlaid with “N”. 7 2 1–3 SEQUENCE NUMBER — Must be numeric 1–999, starting with position 1 of line 2. Positions 2 and 3 may be blank or non-overlaid literal (e.g. 4EQ). a. Begin with “1” daily b. Mark the SEQUENCE NUMBER on the assembled source document(s) for each case ﬁle. This number allows the service center return ﬁles function to associate the source documents with the matching CHK64 — generated IDRS Transaction Record. 8 2 5–6 C# — CASE CONTROL NUMBER — # may be overlaid with 1–9 or A–Z if a case control is already established and is being updated; otherwise, C# is inserted. 9 2 8–15 IRS RECEIVED DATE — a. Must be input as numeric in MMDDCCYY format. b. Must not be greater than the current date. c. Current date must not be more than 1 year from date entered. 10 2 17–18 FILE LOCATOR CODE — May be blanks or “FL” unless a 66 or 98 district office input and the service center code is for Philadelphia. 11 2 20 INTEREST INDICATOR — With proper authorized documentation in the case ﬁle, this indicator may be set to indicate interest is due. ’N’ is generated and must be overlaid with ’Y’ in order to indicate that interest should
a. Begin with “1” daily

INTEREST INDICATOR — With proper authorized documentation in the case ﬁle, this indicator may be set to indicate interest is due. ’N’ is generated and must be overlaid with ’Y’ in order to indicate that interest should be paid.

, hyphen (-), diagonal sign (/), and blank. (However, the ﬁrst position cannot be a blank.) The word “LOCAL” must be input if there is no street address. BMF–CY/ST/ZP IMF–CY/ST/ZPCITYSTATEAND ZIP CODE–There must be an entry in this ﬁeld. Enter data beginning in position
The ﬁeld may extend to position
for IMF and to position
for BMF. Entries may overlay “=” in both situations. The order of data input is:
CITY followed by a comma.
A valid State abbreviation followed by a blank.
ZIP CODE Valid entries for each ﬁeld are discussed below:
CITY–At least three valid characters must be present. These may be
, A-Z and blank. Major city codes are also valid. A comma must follow the city ﬁeld.

STATE–A valid state entry must follow the city and comma. For domestic address changes this entry consists of a valid state abbreviation. There is one exception:Ifamajorcity code is being entered a state abbreviation must not be used (Therefore, if entering the major city code for Dallas, Texas, your entry would be DA,
; you must proceed to the zip code entry after input of the Major City Code). If a foreign address is being entered the correct entry is a period. (MEXICO,.)
ZIP CODE–Enter data following the state and blank. Your entry must be ﬁve numeric characters ranging from
to

If a foreign address has been entered (indicated by a period) do not enter a zip code–depress the New Line key after the period. The zip code will be cross checked against the state given , according to the zip sectional center/s for that state. If the ﬁrst three characters of the zip code (which denotes the sectional center) is not valid for the state input then an ’*’ will be displayed on CY/ST/ZP line. If proper procedures have been followed to document the zip code used as valid for the state, the ’*’ may be over-
If name and address are not present on IDRS, this information must be entered so that it may be printed on the Notice 564.

Exhibit 2.4.21-2 (Cont. 5) CHK64R Output Display
Description and Validity IMF FIRST NAME LINE — Enter data beginning in position
The ﬁeld extends to position

and the “+”s may be overlaid. The ﬁrst name line may contain a ﬁrst name, a surname and a suffix. A right-hand bracket (]) must precede the surname. If there is a suffex present then a comma (,) must follow the surname and precede the suffix (i.e. John L]Jones Jr or William] Lee, III) A surname must be at least two valid characters. The valid characters are A–Z, hyphen, blank, right-hand bracket and ampersand. Characters following two or more sequential blanks are invalid. SECOND NAME LINE — Data in ﬁeld begins in
and extends to position
, overlaying “+”s. Valid characters are A–Z,

, ampersand, hyphen, %, /, and blanks; characters following two or more sequential blanks are invalid. If the second name line is entered, First Name Line, New Name Control, Filing Status Code, and Year Digits must also be present. If a second name line is entered on prior year period, it will not update at Master File. NEW NAME CONTROL — Overlay the “+”s. The ﬁrst position must be alpha; the other positions may be alpha, hyphen, or blank; however, blanks may not appear between characters. The First Name Line must be present and the New Name Control must be equal the Name Control as indicated on the First Name Line. FILING STATUS CODE — The generated FSC will be the same that is present on the TIF module. The operator may change the FSC by overlying it with another. Valid characters are
Year Digits must also be present. If the First Name Line contains an ampersand (&), the FSC must be “
” or “
” otherwise,
or

” through the current year. Spouse’s SSN — Overlay the literal with nine numeric for SSN format (XXX-XX-XXXX). The entry cannot be all zeros or all nines and cannot be the same as the
